span.span: Provides a wrapper on a core XML signature object to facilitate creating XML signatures.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类是万维网联合会 (W3C) 的.NET Framework 实现[XML 签名语法和处理规范](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/)，也称为 XMLDSIG （XML 数字签名）。The class is the .NET Framework implementation of the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) [XML Signature Syntax and Processing Specification](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/), also known as XMLDSIG (XML Digital Signature). XMLDSIG 是基于标准的、 可互操作的方式进行签名和验证所有或部分 XML 文档或是可寻址从统一资源标识符 (URI) 的其他数据。XMLDSIG is a standards-based, interoperable way to sign and verify all or part of an XML document or other data that is addressable from a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). 使用无论何时需要共享的类在一种标准方式登录应用程序或组织之间的 XML 数据。Use the class whenever you need to share signed XML data between applications or organizations in a standard way. 使用此类签名的任何数据可通过 XMLDSIG W3C 规范的任何一致性实现验证。Any data signed using this class can be verified by any conforming implementation of the W3C specification for XMLDSIG. 类允许你创建的 XML 数字签名的以下三类：The class allows you to create the following three kinds of XML digital signatures: |签名类型Signature Type|描述Description| |--------------------|-----------------| |封装的签名Enveloped signature|签名包含在正进行签名的 XML 元素。The signature is contained within the XML element being signed.| |封装签名Enveloping signature|签名的 XML 包含在 <`Signature`> 元素。The signed XML is contained within the <`Signature`> element.| |内部分离的签名Internal detached signature|签名和签名的 XML 都在同一文档中，但两个元素中包含的其他。The signature and signed XML are in the same document, but neither element contains the other.| 此外，还有第四个种类的调用时，数据和签名位于单独的 XML 文档的外部分离的签名的签名。There is also a fourth kind of signature called an external detached signature which is when the data and signature are in separate XML documents. 不支持外部分离的签名类。External detached signatures are not supported by the class. ## XML 签名的结构The structure of an XML Signature XMLDSIG 创建 <`Signature`> 元素，它包含数字签名的 XML 文档或是可从 URI 寻址的其他数据。XMLDSIG creates a <`Signature`> element, which contains a digital signature of an XML document or other data that is addressable from a URI. <`Signature`> 元素可以根据需要包含有关在何处可以找到将验证签名的密钥信息和哪种加密算法用于签名。The <`Signature`> element can optionally contain information about where to find a key that will verify the signature and which cryptographic algorithm was used for signing. 基本结构如下所示：The basic structure is as follows: ```xml Base64EncodedValue== AnotherBase64EncodedValue=== ``` 此结构的主要部分是：The main parts of this structure are: <`CanonicalizationMethod`> 元素The <`CanonicalizationMethod`> element 指定重写规则`Signature`从 XML/文本元素插入签名验证的字节数。Specifies the rules for rewriting the `Signature` element from XML/text into bytes for signature validation. .NET Framework 中的默认值是http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315，它标识可信的算法。The default value in the .NET Framework is http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315, which identifies a trustworthy algorithm. 此元素表示由属性。This element is represented by the property. <`SignatureMethod`> 元素The <`SignatureMethod`> element 指定用于签名生成和验证，已应用于的算法 <`Signature`> 元素以生成中的值 <`SignatureValue`>。Specifies the algorithm used for signature generation and validation, which was applied to the <`Signature`> element to produce the value in <`SignatureValue`>. 在上面的值的示例http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1标识的 RSA PKCS1 sha-1 签名。In the example above, the value http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1 identifies an RSA PKCS1 SHA-1 signature. 此元素表示由属性。This element is represented by the property. <`SignatureValue`> 元素The <`SignatureValue`> element 指定的加密签名 <`Signature`> 元素。Specifies the cryptographic signature for the <`Signature`> element. 如果此签名不会验证，然后的某些部分 <`Signature`> 块被篡改、 和文档将被视为无效。If this signature does not verify, then some portion of the <`Signature`> block was tampered with, and the document is considered invalid. 只要 <`CanonicalizationMethod`> 值是可信，此值是有效防止篡改。As long as the <`CanonicalizationMethod`> value is trustworthy, this value is highly resistant to tampering. 此元素表示由属性。This element is represented by the property. `URI`属性 <`Reference`> 元素The `URI` attribute of the <`Reference`> element 指定使用一个 URI 引用的数据对象。Specifies a data object using a URI reference. 此属性由属性。This attribute is represented by the property. - 未指定`URI`属性，即设置属性`null`，意味着接收应用程序需要知道对象的标识。Not specifying the `URI` attribute, that is, setting the property to `null`, means that the receiving application is expected to know the identity of the object. 在大多数情况下， `null` URI 会导致引发异常。In most cases, a `null` URI will result in an exception being thrown. 不要使用`null`URI，除非你的应用程序与要求协议互操作性。Do not use a `null` URI, unless your application is interoperating with a protocol which requires it. - 设置`URI`属性为空字符串指示，文档的根元素进行签名，封装签名中的一种形式。Setting the `URI` attribute to an empty string indicates that the root element of the document is being signed, a form of enveloped signature. - 如果值`URI`属性开头 #，则值必须解析为当前文档中的元素。If the value of `URI` attribute starts with #, then the value must resolve to an element in the current document. 此窗体可与任何受支持的签名类型 （封装签名，封装签名或内部分离的签名）。This form can be used with any of the supported signature types (enveloped signature, enveloping signature or internal detached signature). - 任何其他内容被视为分离的外部资源签名和不受类。Anything else is considered an external resource detached signature and is not supported by the class. <`Transforms`> 元素The <`Transforms`> element 包含已排序的列表 <`Transform`> 已融会贯通说明如何签名者获取的数据对象的元素。Contains an ordered list of <`Transform`> elements that describe how the signer obtained the data object that was digested. 转换算法是类似于规范化方法，但无需重写 <`Signature`> 元素，它将重写由标识内容`URI`属性 <`Reference`> 元素。A transform algorithm is similar to the canonicalization method, but instead of rewriting the <`Signature`> element, it rewrites the content identified by the `URI` attribute of the <`Reference`> element. <`Transforms`> 元素表示由类。The <`Transforms`> element is represented by the class. - 每个转换算法定义为采用作为输入的 XML (XPath 节点集) 或字节。Each transform algorithm is defined as taking either XML (an XPath node-set) or bytes as input. 如果当前的数据的格式不同于转换输入要求，转换规则将应用。If the format of the current data differs from the transform input requirements, conversion rules are applied. - 每个转换算法被定义为生成 XML 或字节作为输出。Each transform algorithm is defined as producing either XML or bytes as the output. - 如果最后一个转换算法的输出未定义以字节为单位 （或指定不转换），然后规范化方法http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315用作隐式转换 (即使在指定了不同的算法 <`CanonicalizationMethod`>元素）。If the output of the last transform algorithm is not defined in bytes (or no transforms were specified), then the canonicalization method http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315 is used as an implicit transform (even if a different algorithm was specified in the <`CanonicalizationMethod`> element). - 值为http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#enveloped-signature用于转换的算法进行编码的规则将被解释为删除 <`Signature`> 从文档的元素。A value of http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#enveloped-signature for the transform algorithm encodes a rule which is interpreted as remove the <`Signature`> element from the document. 否则为封装签名中的一个验证程序将摘要式文档，包括签名，但签名人将具有融会贯通文档之前应用签名，从而导致不同的答案。Otherwise, a verifier of an enveloped signature will digest the document, including the signature, but the signer would have digested the document before the signature was applied, leading to different answers. <`DigestMethod`> 元素The <`DigestMethod`> element 标识要将应用于由标识转换后的内容的摘要 （加密哈希） 方法`URI`属性 <`Reference`> 元素。Identifies the digest (cryptographic hash) method to apply on the transformed content identified by the `URI` attribute of the <`Reference`> element. 这由属性。This is represented by the property. ## 选择规范化方法Choosing a canonicalization method 除非使用规范这需要使用不同的值的互操作性，否则我们建议你在.NET Framework 即 XML C14N 1.0 算法，其值是使用默认的规范化方法http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315。Unless interoperating with a specification which requires the use of a different value, we recommend that you use the default canonicalization method in the .NET Framework which is the XML-C14N 1.0 algorithm, whose value is http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315. XML C14N 1.0 算法需要支持的所有实现的 XMLDSIG，尤其当它是要应用的隐式最终转换。The XML-C14N 1.0 algorithm is required to be supported by all implementations of XMLDSIG, particularly as it is an implicit final transform to apply. 有的规范化算法支持保留注释的版本。There are versions of canonicalization algorithms which support preserving comments. 不建议注释保留规范化方法，因为它们违反"签名所看到的内容"原则。Comment-preserving canonicalization methods are not recommended because they violate the "sign what is seen" principle. 也就是说中的注释 <`Signature`> 元素将不会更改处理逻辑，有关如何执行签名，则只是哪些签名值。That is, the comments in a <`Signature`> element will not alter the processing logic for how the signature is performed, merely what the signature value is. 当结合弱签名算法，允许攻击者不必要能够自由地进行强制哈希冲突，要包括的提供的注释进行篡改的文档显示合法。When combined with a weak signature algorithm, allowing the comments to be included gives an attacker unnecessary freedom to force a hash collision, making a tampered document appear legitimate. 在.NET Framework 中，默认情况下支持仅内置 canonicalizers。In the .NET Framework, only built-in canonicalizers are supported by default. 若要支持其他或自定义 canonicalizers，请参阅属性。To support additional or custom canonicalizers, see the property. 如果文档是否使用不是由集合中的规范化方法属性，则方法将返回`false`。If the document uses a canonicalization method that is not in the collection represented by the property, then the method will return `false`. > [!NOTE] > 极防御性应用程序可以删除不需要签署人要使用的任何值集合。An extremely defensive application can remove any values it does not expect signers to use from the collection. ## 是引用的值不被篡改安全？Are the Reference values safe from tampering? 是，<`Reference`> 的值为安全不被篡改。Yes, the <`Reference`> values are safe from tampering. .NET framework 验证 <`SignatureValue`> 在处理的任何之前的计算 <`Reference`> 值和其关联转换和尽早以避免潜在的恶意的处理指令将中止。The .NET framework verifies the <`SignatureValue`> computation before processing any of the <`Reference`> values and their associated transforms, and will abort early to avoid potentially malicious processing instructions. ## 选择要签名的元素Choosing the elements to sign 我们建议你使用的值""为`URI`属性 (或设置属性为空字符串)，如有可能。We recommend that you use the value of "" for the `URI` attribute (or set the property to an empty string), if possible. 这意味着整个文档视为摘要计算，这意味着整个文档保护不被篡改。This means the whole document is considered for the digest computation, which means the whole document is protected from tampering. 它是很常见，若要查看`URI`如 #foo，其 ID 属性为"foo"的元素引用的锚表单中的值。It is very common to see `URI` values in the form of anchors such as #foo, referring to an element whose ID attribute is "foo". 遗憾的是，很容易使这种方式会被篡改，因为其中包括仅目标元素，而不是用上下文的内容。Unfortunately, it is easy for this to be tampered with because this includes only the content of the target element, not the context. 滥用这一区别已知作为 XML 签名包装 (XSW)。Abusing this distinction is known as XML Signature Wrapping (XSW). 如果你的应用程序认为语义的注释 （这不是公共的在处理 XML），则应使用"#xpointer(/)"而不是""，和"#xpointer(id('foo'))"而不是"#foo"。If your application considers comments to be semantic (which is not common when dealing with XML), then you should use "#xpointer(/)" instead of "", and "#xpointer(id('foo'))" instead of "#foo". #Xpointer 版本都会被解释为包括注释，而短名称窗体不包括注释。The #xpointer versions are interpreted as including comments, while the shortname forms are excluding comments. 如果你需要接受仅部分受保护的文档，并且你想要确保你正在阅读的内容相同签名保护，请使用方法。If you need to accept documents which are only partially protected and you want to ensure that you are reading the same content that the signature protected, use the method. ## 有关 KeyInfo 元素的安全注意事项Security considerations about the KeyInfo element 可选中的数据 <`KeyInfo`> 元素 (即，属性)，其中包含要验证的签名的密钥不应为受信任。The data in the optional <`KeyInfo`> element (that is, the property), which contains a key to validate the signature, should not be trusted. 特别地，当值表示裸机 RSA、 DSA 或 ECDSA 公钥，该文档可能已被篡改，尽管reporting 签名是否有效的方法。In particular, when the value represents a bare RSA, DSA or ECDSA public key, the document could have been tampered with, despite the method reporting that the signature is valid. 这可能是因为执行篡改只实体必须生成新密钥并使用该新密钥重新对篡改过的文档。This can happen because the entity doing the tampering just has to generate a new key and re-sign the tampered document with that new key. 因此，除非你的应用程序验证的公钥预期值，就像它已篡改应被视为文档。So, unless your application verifies that the public key is an expected value, the document should be treated as if it were tampered with. 这需要你的应用程序检查文档中嵌入的公钥，并验证其为文档上下文的已知值的列表。This requires that your application examine the public key embedded within the document and verify it against a list of known values for the document context. 例如，如果无法理解文档由已知用户颁发，则将检查该用户使用的已知键的列表项。For example, if the document could be understood to be issued by a known user, you'd check the key against a list of known keys used by that user. 你还可以通过使用处理文档之后验证密钥方法，而不是使用方法。You can also verify the key after processing the document by using the method, instead of using the method. 但是，为获得最佳安全性，你应验证的密钥事先。But, for the optimal security, you should verify the key beforehand. 或者，请考虑尝试用户的注册公钥，而不是读取中 <`KeyInfo`> 元素。Alternately, consider trying the user's registered public keys, rather than reading what's in the <`KeyInfo`> element. ## 有关 X509Data 元素的安全注意事项Security considerations about the X509Data element 可选 <`X509Data`> 元素是的子元素 <`KeyInfo`> 元素包含一个或多个 X509 和证书或标识符的 X509 证书。The optional <`X509Data`> element is a child of the <`KeyInfo`> element and contains one or more X509 certificates or identifiers for X509 certificates. 中的数据 <`X509Data`> 元素也不应为本质上受信任。The data in the <`X509Data`> element should also not be inherently trusted. 验证具有嵌入的文档时 <`X509Data`> 元素，.NET Framework 仅验证数据解析为 X509 证书可以成功使用其公钥来验证文档签名。When verifying a document with the embedded <`X509Data`> element, the .NET Framework verifies only that the data resolves to an X509 certificate whose public key can be successfully used to validate the document signature. 与调用不同方法替换`verifySignatureOnly`参数设置为`false`、 执行没有吊销检查，无链信任已选中，和验证不会过期。Unlike calling the method with the `verifySignatureOnly` parameter set to `false`, no revocation check is performed, no chain trust is checked, and no expiration is verified. 即使你的应用程序提取证书本身并将其传递给方法替换`verifySignatureOnly`参数设置为`false`，即仍不充分的验证，以防止篡改文档。Even if your application extracts the certificate itself and passes it to the method with the `verifySignatureOnly` parameter set to `false`, that is still not sufficient validation to prevent document tampering. 证书仍需要为适合于正进行签名的文档进行验证。The certificate still needs to be verified as being appropriate for the document being signed. 使用嵌入的签名证书可以是否提供有用的密钥轮换策略，在 <`X509Data`> 部分或文档内容中。Using an embedded signing certificate can provide useful key rotation strategies, whether in the <`X509Data`> section or in the document content. 使用此方法时应用程序应手动提取证书，然后执行验证类似于：When using this approach an application should extract the certificate manually and perform validation similar to: - 证书已颁发直接或通过链的证书颁发机构 (CA) 的公用证书嵌入到应用程序。The certificate was issued directly or via a chain by a Certificate Authority (CA) whose public certificate is embedded in the application. 使用无需进行其他检查，已知的使用者名称，如提供 OS 信任列表不足以防止篡改中。Using the OS-provided trust list without additional checks, such as a known subject name, is not sufficient to prevent tampering in . - 验证该证书尚未过期的文档签名时 （或"现在"的接近实时的文档处理）。The certificate is verified to have not been expired at the time of document signing (or "now" for near real-time document processing). - 对于支持吊销特定 CA 颁发的生存期很长的证书，验证未吊销证书。For long-lived certificates issued by a CA which supports revocation, verify the certificate was not revoked. - 证书使用者验证为适合于当前文档中。The certificate subject is verified as being appropriate to the current document. ## 选择转换算法Choosing the transform algorithm 如果进行互操作使用规范的具有指定特定值 （如 XrML)，则你需要遵循规范。If you are interoperating with a specification which has dictated specific values (such as XrML), then you need to follow the specification. 如果你有封装的签名中 (例如，当签名整个文档)，则需要使用http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#enveloped-signature(由表示类)。If you have an enveloped signature (such as when signing the whole document), then you need to use http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#enveloped-signature (represented by the class). 你可以指定隐式的 XML C14N 转换，但不需要。You can specify the implicit XML-C14N transform as well, but it's not necessary. 为信封或已分离的签名，需要不的任何转换。For an enveloping or detached signature, no transforms are required. 隐式的 XML C14N 转换负责所有内容。The implicit XML-C14N transform takes care of everything. 使用更新的安全性通过引入[Microsoft 安全公告 MS16-035](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/security/ms16-035.aspx)，.NET Framework 具有受限转换可以是文档验证默认情况下，与使用不受信任的转换导致始终返回`false`。With the security updated introduced by the [Microsoft Security Bulletin MS16-035](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/security/ms16-035.aspx), the .NET Framework has restricted what transforms can be used in document verification by default, with untrusted transforms causing to always return `false`. 具体而言，这需要附加输入 （指定为 XML 中的子元素） 的转换不再允许由于其可能性滥用行为被恶意用户。In particular, transforms which require additional input (specified as child elements in the XML) are no longer allowed due to their susceptibility of abuse by malicious users. W3C 建议避免 XPath 和 XSLT 转换，它们是受这些限制的两种主要转换。The W3C advises avoiding the XPath and XSLT transforms, which are the two main transforms affected by these restrictions. ## 与外部引用的问题The problem with external references 如果应用程序不会验证外部引用都不适合于当前上下文，它们可能会被滥用以提供对许多安全漏洞 （包括拒绝的服务，分布式反射拒绝服务，信息的方式泄露、 签名绕过和远程执行代码）。If an application does not verify that external references seem appropriate for the current context, they can be abused in ways that provide for many security vulnerabilities (including Denial of Service, Distributed Reflection Denial of Service, Information Disclosure, Signature Bypass, and Remote Code Execution). 即使应用程序是验证外部引用 URI，剩下两次加载的资源问题： 一旦你的应用程序时读取它，并且一旦时读取它。Even if an application were to validate the external reference URI, there would remain a problem of the resource being loaded twice: once when your application reads it, and once when reads it. 由于没有应用程序读取和文档，验证步骤具有相同的内容不能保证，签名不提供可信赖性。Since there’s no guarantee that the application read and document verify steps have the same content, the signature does not provide trustworthiness. 给定的外部引用，风险遇到的外部引用时，将引发异常。Given the risks of external references, will throw an exception when an external reference is encountered. 有关此问题的详细信息，请参阅[知识库文章 3148821](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/3148821)。For more information about this issue, see [KB article 3148821](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/3148821). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何进行签名和验证使用封装的签名中的整个 XML 文档。The following code example shows how to sign and verify an entire XML document using an enveloped signature.
